title: DisplacementEvent
description: A displacement event is a description of the age, environment and process of a shear displacement event.

eventEnvironment-1.title: eventEnvironment
eventEnvironment-1.description: The <font color="#4f81bd">eventEnvironment</font> property (<font color="#4f81bd">SWE::Category</font>) is a category from a controlled vocabulary identifying the physical setting within which a <font color="#4f81bd">GeologicEvent</font> takes place. Event environment is construed broadly to include physical settings on the Earth surface specified by climate, tectonics, physiography or geography, and settings in the Earth’s interior specified by pressure, temperature, chemical environment, or tectonics.

eventEnvironment-2.title: eventEnvironment
eventEnvironment-2.description: The <font color="#4f81bd">eventEnvironment</font> property (<font color="#4f81bd">SWE::Category</font>) is a category from a controlled vocabulary identifying the physical setting within which a <font color="#4f81bd">GeologicEvent</font> takes place. Event environment is construed broadly to include physical settings on the Earth surface specified by climate, tectonics, physiography or geography, and settings in the Earth’s interior specified by pressure, temperature, chemical environment, or tectonics.

eventEnvironment-3.title: eventEnvironment
eventEnvironment-3.description: The <font color="#4f81bd">eventEnvironment</font> property (<font color="#4f81bd">SWE::Category</font>) is a category from a controlled vocabulary identifying the physical setting within which a <font color="#4f81bd">GeologicEvent</font> takes place. Event environment is construed broadly to include physical settings on the Earth surface specified by climate, tectonics, physiography or geography, and settings in the Earth’s interior specified by pressure, temperature, chemical environment, or tectonics.

eventProcess-1.title: eventProcess
eventProcess-1.description: The <font color="#4f81bd">eventProcess:EventProcessTerm</font> property provides a term from a controlled vocabulary specifying the process or processes that occurred during the event. Examples include deposition, extrusion, intrusion, cooling.

eventProcess-2.title: eventProcess
eventProcess-2.description: The <font color="#4f81bd">eventProcess:EventProcessTerm</font> property provides a term from a controlled vocabulary specifying the process or processes that occurred during the event. Examples include deposition, extrusion, intrusion, cooling.

eventProcess-3.title: eventProcess
eventProcess-3.description: The <font color="#4f81bd">eventProcess:EventProcessTerm</font> property provides a term from a controlled vocabulary specifying the process or processes that occurred during the event. Examples include deposition, extrusion, intrusion, cooling.

numericAge.reportingDate.title: reportingDate
numericAge.reportingDate.description: The <font color="#4f81bd">reportingDate</font> (<font color="#4f81bd">SWE::Quantity</font>) property reports a single time coordinate value to report as representative for this <font color="#4f81bd">NumericAge</font> assignment.

numericAge.olderBoundDate.title: olderBoundDate
numericAge.olderBoundDate.description: The <font color="#4f81bd">olderBoundDate</font> (<font color="#4f81bd">SWE::Quantity</font>) property reports the older bounding time coordinate in an age range.

numericAge.youngerBoundDate.title: youngerBoundDate
numericAge.youngerBoundDate.description: The <font color="#4f81bd">youngerBoundDate</font> (<font color="#4f81bd">SWE::Quantity</font>) property reports the younger bounding time coordinate in an age range.

olderNamedAge.title: olderNamedAge
olderNamedAge.description: The property <font color="#4f81bd">olderNamedAge:GeochronologicalEraTerm</font> defines the older boundary of age of an event expressed using a geochronologic era defined according to a geologic time scale as per the <font color="#4f81bd">GeologicTime</font> schema (eg, the International Commission on Stratigraphy Chronostratigraphic Chart - http://www.stratigraphy.org/index.php/ics-chart-timescale).

youngerNamedAge.title: youngerNamedAge
youngerNamedAge.description: The property <font color="#4f81bd">youngerNamedAge:GeochronologicalEraTerm</font> defines the younger boundary of age of event expressed using a geochronologic era defined according to a geologic time scale per the <font color="#4f81bd">GeologicTime</font> schema. (eg, the International Commission on Stratigraphy Chronostratigraphic Chart - http://www.stratigraphy.org/index.php/ics-chart-timescale).

incrementalDisplacement.hangingWallDirec.title: directed
incrementalDisplacement.hangingWallDirec.description: The <font color="#4f81bd">directed:LinearDirectedCode</font> property indicates if the orientation represents a linear feature that is directed, e.g. clast imbrication, mylonitic lineation with sense of shear, slickenlines with displacement direction, rather than undirected (like a fold hinge line or intersection lineations).  A code list will indicate which is the directed end of the linear orientation.  The value of the property comes from a controlled vocabulary.

incrementalDisplacement.hangingWallDirec.title: plunge
incrementalDisplacement.hangingWallDirec.description: The property <font color="#4f81bd">plunge</font> (<font color="#4f81bd">SWE::QuantityRange</font>) reports the magnitude of the plunge as an angle from horizontal.

incrementalDisplacement.hangingWallDirec.title: trend
incrementalDisplacement.hangingWallDirec.description: The property <font color="#4f81bd">trend</font> (<font color="#4f81bd">SWE::QuantityRange</font>) reports the azimuth (compass bearing) value of the linear orientation.

incrementalDisplacement.movementSense.title: movementSense
incrementalDisplacement.movementSense.description: The property <font color="#4f81bd">movementSense:MovementSenseTerm</font> contains a term from a controlled vocabulary that describes the movement sense of displacement along a geologic structure (e.g., dextral, sinistral).

incrementalDisplacement.movementType.title: movementType
incrementalDisplacement.movementType.description: The property <font color="#4f81bd">movementType:MovementTypeTerm</font> contains a term from a controlled vocabulary that defines the type of movement on a shear displacement structure (e.g. dip-slip, strike-slip).

incrementalDisplacement.displacementEven.title: displacementEvent
incrementalDisplacement.displacementEven.description: The property displacementEvent is an association between a Displacement and a GeologicEvent that contains a description of the age, environment and process of a shear displacement event.

incrementalDisplacement.displacementEven.title: displacementEvent
incrementalDisplacement.displacementEven.description: The property displacementEvent is an association between a Displacement and a GeologicEvent that contains a description of the age, environment and process of a shear displacement event.

incrementalDisplacement.displacementEven.title: displacementEvent
incrementalDisplacement.displacementEven.description: The property displacementEvent is an association between a Displacement and a GeologicEvent that contains a description of the age, environment and process of a shear displacement event.
